description: The Bamiyan Valley is a UNESCO World Heritage cultural landscape with major archaeological and Buddhist heritage sites. Travelers drawn to history and highland scenery find a profound sense of place.
UNESCO-listed Butrint blends archaeology and nature, while Berat and Gjirokastra showcase historic urban heritage. Travelers love the layered history and distinctive townscapes.
Tassili nâ€™Ajjer is a UNESCO site famed for prehistoric rock art and dramatic sandstone landscapes. DjÃ©mila adds remarkably preserved Roman-era architecture and mosaics.
The National Park of American Samoa protects rainforest, reef, and Samoan cultural heritage across the islands. Visitors come for the natural beauty and living traditions.
The UNESCO-listed Madriu-Perafita-Claror Valley captures the Pyreneesâ€™ cultural landscape and pastoral heritage. Travelers love the mountain scenery and deep sense of tradition.
Mbanza Kongo, a UNESCO World Heritage site, preserves the former capital of the Kingdom of Kongo. Visitors drawn to history experience the legacy of a major African state.
Anguilla is known for its many beaches with white sand and clear, calm waters. The island is also celebrated for its award-winning dining scene.
Antarctica is the worldâ€™s largest wilderness and remains relatively pristine. Travelers seek its polar landscapes and emblematic wildlife such as penguins.
The UNESCO-listed Antigua Naval Dockyard preserves Georgian-era naval structures set within sheltered bays. Visitors are drawn to the islandâ€™s maritime heritage and history.
IguazÃº National Park is a UNESCO World Heritage site with one of the worldâ€™s most spectacular waterfall systems. The surrounding subtropical rainforest adds rich biodiversity and wildlife.
Its character comes from history, culture, and lived-in charm in Armenia. The mix of history and modern life makes it a classic trip.
Eagle Beach has been recognized by Tripadvisor as one of the worldâ€™s best beaches. Travelers come for its white sand and clear, calm waters.
The Great Barrier Reef is a UNESCO World Heritage site and the worldâ€™s largest collection of coral reefs. Visitors are drawn by its remarkable marine biodiversity and seascapes.
Viennaâ€™s historic centre is a UNESCO World Heritage site known for its architectural ensembles and the Ringstrasse. Travelers come for the cityâ€™s heritage and celebrated musical legacy.
Bakuâ€™s walled city with the Shirvanshahâ€™s Palace and Maiden Tower is a UNESCO World Heritage site. Visitors come for the historic city walls, palace complex, and deep cultural layers.
Color, culture, and daily life give it its spark in Bahamas. Visitors come for the food, music, and human connection.
Heritage and everyday life create a distinct atmosphere in Bahrain. The mix of tradition and daily life keeps it captivating.
The Sundarbans is a UNESCO World Heritage site and the worldâ€™s largest contiguous mangrove forest. Travelers visit for its rare wildlife and unique delta landscapes.
Historic Bridgetown and its Garrison is a UNESCO World Heritage site tied to British colonial trade and defense. Visitors come for its preserved historic townscape and waterfront heritage.
Culture, heritage, and everyday life make it distinctive in Belarus. The mix of history and modern life makes it a classic trip.
Brusselsâ€™ Grand-Place is a UNESCO World Heritage site and an exceptional architectural ensemble. Travelers come for its historic square and richly preserved civic buildings.
